notes: regular -are verb; used with auxiliary avere
example_sentence_english: I like to smoke after dinner.
I smoke a pack a day.
When I was young I smoked a lot.

translation_english: he was smoking/she was smoking/you (formal) were smoking
example_sentence_english: My grandfather used to smoke every evening.
We used to smoke outside during breaks.
You used to smoke a lot then.
They were smoking near the exit.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'fumato'
used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'fumato'

translation_english: he has smoked/she has smoked/you (formal) have smoked
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'
used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'fumato'
used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'fumato'
used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'fumato'
